summary: This is an FBI FD-302 interview summary of a witness, identified as a former underage victim/recruiter for Jeffrey Epstein. She details being recruited at age 14, bringing other underage girls to Epstein's residence for massages that escalated to sexual contact, and the payment structure. She also describes post-arrest contact from Epstein's associate and subsequent legal proceedings.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central figure accused of sexually abusing underage girls. The witness describes being recruited for him at age 14, his sexual conduct during massages, his preferences for young girls, and his payment methods.

persons.name: Sarah
persons.context: The primary witness being interviewed. She was recruited at age 14 to give Epstein massages and later recruited other underage girls for him. She describes the abuse, payment, and her later interactions with Epstein's associates and the legal system.

persons.name: Sarah Kellen
persons.context: Described by the witness as Epstein's 'live-in assistant.' She would schedule appointments, pay the girls, and relay messages from Epstein about which girls he liked.

persons.name: Bob Critton
persons.context: An attorney that Sarah Kellen told the witness would represent her after Epstein's arrest, advising her not to talk.

persons.name: Brad Edwards
persons.context: An attorney the witness eventually contacted and met with after clashing with the attorney provided by Epstein's associates.

persons.name: AUSA A. S.
persons.context: Present for the FBI interview of the witness.

persons.name: Task Force Officer
persons.context: Present for the FBI interview of the witness.

persons.name: Special Agent
persons.context: Present for and conducting the FBI interview of the witness.

connections.description: Sarah was a victim of sexual abuse by Epstein, starting when she was 14. She also acted as a recruiter, bringing other underage girls to him.
Sarah Kellen is described as Epstein's 'live-in assistant' who managed scheduling, payments, and communications with the girls.
Sarah Kellen interacted with the witness, paying her, calling her to schedule appointments, and later contacting her after Epstein's arrest to offer legal representation and assurances.
Sarah Kellen told the witness that Bob Critton would be her attorney after Epstein's arrest, though the witness did not ultimately use him.
The witness contacted and met with attorney Brad Edwards after rejecting the attorney provided by Epstein's associates.

events.title: FBI Interview of Witness
events.description: The witness is interviewed by the FBI, an AUSA, and a Task Force Officer at the law offices of Boies Schiller Flexner in Fort Lauderdale, Florida.

events.title: Witness's Recruitment and Abuse by Epstein
events.description: The witness, at age 14, is introduced to Jeffrey Epstein and begins visiting his residence approximately 60 times over 3-4 years for massages that involve sexual contact. She also recruits other underage girls for him.

events.title: Epstein's Arrest and Aftermath
events.description: After seeing Epstein's mug shot on TV, the witness is contacted by Sarah Kellen, who tells her not to worry, that she will be taken care of, and provides attorney Bob Critton's information.

events.title: Witness Gives Depositions and Media Interview
events.description: The witness gives depositions for both criminal and civil proceedings related to Epstein. She also gives an interview to the Miami Herald, after which she is harassed by journalists and has to change her phone number.

events.title: Harassment by Epstein's Investigators
events.description: The witness states she heard that Epstein's investigators were harassing another victim, shining lights in her window, leading to that victim being placed in a hotel.

locations: 401 E Las Olas Blvd, Fort Lauderdale, Florida (Law offices of Boies Schiller Flexner - interview location)
Epstein's residence (location of the abuse, specific address not given in this excerpt)
keyFacts: The witness was recruited for Jeffrey Epstein at age 14 at a high school party with an offer of $200 for a massage, initially lying that she was 16.
She visited Epstein's residence approximately 60 times over 3-4 years and was paid to recruit other underage girls, earning $200 per girl she brought.
Epstein was explicit about his preferences, disliking black or mixed girls, and communicated his likes/dislikes through his assistant, Sarah Kellen.
After Epstein's arrest, his assistant Sarah Kellen contacted the witness, told her not to talk, and offered to provide an attorney (Bob Critton), indicating an effort to control witnesses.
The witness describes a pattern where massages for Epstein involved sexual contact (e.g., pinching his nipples while he held the girl), and he was 'super casual' about it, making it seem normal.
